hints_html:
The expected value of a random variable \(X\) with probability density function \(f(x)\), which we denote by \(\mathbb{E}[X]\), is given by :

\[\begin{aligned} \mathbb{E}[X] = \int_{-\infty}^{\infty}xf(x)\,dx.\end{aligned}\]
hints_raw:
The <b>expected value</b> of a random variable <math>X</math> with probability density function <math>f(x)</math>, which we denote by <math>\mathbb{E}[X]</math>, is given by :
:<math>
\mathbb{E}[X] = \int_{-\infty}^{\infty}xf(x)\,dx.
</math>
question: 1 (n)
sols_html:
The expected value of a random variable \(X\) with probability density function \(f(x)\), which we denote by \(\mathbb{E}[X]\), is given by :

\[\begin{aligned} \mathbb{E}[X] = \int_{-\infty}^{\infty}xf(x)\,dx.\end{aligned}\]

In this case, the expected value is given by

\[\begin{aligned} \mathbb{E}[X] &= \int_{1}^{4}x\left(\frac{2}{9\sqrt[3]{x}}\right)\,dx = \frac{2}{9}\int_{1}^{4} x^{2/3}\,dx \\ &= \frac{2}{9}\left(\frac{3}{5}x^{5/3}\right)\Big\vert_{1}^{4} = \frac{2}{15}\left(4^{5/3} - 1\right).\end{aligned}\]

Therefore,

\[\begin{aligned} {\color{blue}\mathbb{E}[X] = \frac{2}{15}\left(4^{5/3} -1\right)}.\end{aligned}\]
sols_raw:
The <b>expected value</b> of a random variable <math>X</math> with probability density function <math>f(x)</math>, which we denote by <math>\mathbb{E}[X]</math>, is given by :
:<math>
\mathbb{E}[X] = \int_{-\infty}^{\infty}xf(x)\,dx.
</math>
In this case, the expected value is given by
:<math>
\begin{align}
\mathbb{E}[X] &= \int_{1}^{4}x\left(\frac{2}{9\sqrt[3]{x}}\right)\,dx = \frac{2}{9}\int_{1}^{4} x^{2/3}\,dx \\
&= \frac{2}{9}\left(\frac{3}{5}x^{5/3}\right)\Big\vert_{1}^{4} = \frac{2}{15}\left(4^{5/3} - 1\right).
\end{align}
</math>
<font style="color:blue;">Therefore,</font>
:<math>{\color{blue}\mathbb{E}[X] = \frac{2}{15}\left(4^{5/3} - 1\right)}.</math>
statement_html:
Short-Answer Questions. Put your answer in the box provided but show your work also. Each question is worth 3 marks, but not all questions are of equal difficulty.

Find the expected value of the random variable \(X\) whose probability density function is

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle f(x) = \frac{2}{9\sqrt[3]{x}}, \quad 1 \le x \le 4.\end{aligned}\]
